Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Alignment
 

Enumeration values:
ALIGN_START 
  • Move the field to the left resp. top within the grid cell.
  • Do not resize the field.
  • Minimum requirement for the column resp. row is the current size of the field.
ALIGN_CENTER 
  • Move the field to the center within the grid cell.
  • Do not resize the field.
  • Minimum requirement for the column resp. row is the current size of the field.
ALIGN_END 
  • Move the field to the right resp. bottom within the grid cell.
  • Do not resize the field.
  • Minimum requirement for the column resp. row is the current size of the field.
ALIGN_FILL 
  • Move the field to the left resp. top within the grid cell.
  • Resize the field to fill the entire cell.
  • Participate in using all available container's space by enlarging the column resp. row to the maximum.
Note:
Do not specify ALIGN_FILL for group fields with resizeToChildren turned on. The result will be unpredictable.

Definition at line 49 of file FieldLayoutData.h.

FieldLayoutData (   ) 
 

Creates a new field layout data.

virtual ~FieldLayoutData (   )  [virtual]

Member Function Documentation

Vector getBottomRightMargin (   ) 
 

Returns the bottom and right margin sizes in pixels.

If multiple inner margin specifications apply (e.g. the right margin of one field and the left margin of the field next to it), the maximum margin specification is used, not the sum of both. Exception: The fields area's margin specification always overrides the outer margin specifications of outer fields. The margin can be used for spacing considering neighbors as well, while the padding defines "fixed" size spacing.

Returns:
The bottom and right margin sizes in pixels.
See also:
getBottomRightPadding()

Vector getBottomRightPadding (   ) 
 

Returns the bottom and right padding sizes in pixels.

The padding is the space between the margin and the field. It always reduces the space available for the field and is not related to the padding or margin of any adjacent field or the fields area. It can be used for "fixed" size spacing, while the margin defines spacing considering neighbors as well.

Returns:
The bottom and right padding sizes in pixels.
See also:
getBottomRightMargin()

int getColumnSpan (   ) 
 

Returns the number of consecutive cells the field uses within its row.

0 specifies that is should use all cells up to the end of the row. Same holds if the span is too large, in this case it also uses at last the remaining cells. The cells are built from the container layout data's column specification, and the spans of each field. If a row's span sum exceeds the columns specification, the next row starts.

Returns:
The number of consecutive cells the field uses within its row.

Field* getField (   ) 
 

Returns the field this layout data belongs to.

Returns:
The field this layout data belongs to.

Alignment getHorizontalAlignment (   ) 
 

Returns the horizontal alignment.

This value specifies how the field should be positioned and resized within its cell. The cells are built from the container layout data's column specification, and the spans of each field. If a row's span sum exceeds the columns specification, the next row starts.

Note:
Do not specify ALIGN_FILL for group fields with resizeToChildren turned on. The result will be unpredictable.
Returns:
The horizontal alignment.

Vector getTopLeftMargin (   ) 
 

Returns the top and left margin sizes in pixels.

If multiple inner margin specifications apply (e.g. the right margin of one field and the left margin of the field next to it), the maximum margin specification is used, not the sum of both. Exception: The fields area's margin specification always overrides the outer margin specifications of outer fields. The margin can be used for spacing considering neighbors as well, while the padding defines "fixed" size spacing.

Returns:
The top and left margin sizes in pixels.
See also:
getTopLeftPadding()

Vector getTopLeftPadding (   ) 
 

Returns the top and left padding sizes in pixels.

The padding is the space between the margin and the field. It always reduces the space available for the field and is not related to the padding or margin of any adjacent field or the fields area. It can be used for "fixed" size spacing, while the margin defines spacing considering neighbors as well.

Returns:
The top and left padding sizes in pixels.
See also:
getTopLeftMargin()

Alignment getVerticalAlignment (   ) 
 

Returns the vertical alignment.

This value specifies how the field should be positioned and resized within its cell. The cells are built from the container layout data's column specification, and the spans of each field. If a row's span sum exceeds the columns specification, the next row starts.

Note:
Do not specify ALIGN_FILL for group fields with resizeToChildren turned on. The result will be unpredictable.
Returns:
The vertical alignment.

void layoutIfAutomatic (   )  [protected]
 

Relayouts the fields area, if automatic layouting is enabled.

void setBottomRightMargin (  Vector  bottomRightMargin  ) 
 

Sets the bottom and right margin sizes in pixels.

If multiple inner margin specifications apply (e.g. the right margin of one field and the left margin of the field next to it), the maximum margin specification is used, not the sum of both. Exception: The fields area's margin specification always overrides the outer margin specifications of outer fields. The margin can be used for spacing considering neighbors as well, while the padding defines "fixed" size spacing.

Parameters:
bottomRightMargin The bottom and right margin sizes in pixels.
Note:
Calling this method relayouts the fields area, if automatic layouting is enabled, so consider turning off the automatic layout when doing major changes.
See also:
setBottomRightPadding()

void setColumnSpan (  int  columnSpan  ) 
 

Sets the number of consecutive cells the field uses within its row.

0 specifies that is should use all cells up to the end of the row. Same holds if the span is too large, in this case it also uses at last the remaining cells. The cells are built from the container layout data's column specification, and the spans of each field. If a row's span sum exceeds the columns specification, the next row starts.

Parameters:
columnSpan The number of consecutive cells the field uses within its row.
Note:
Calling this method relayouts the fields area, if automatic layouting is enabled, so consider turning off the automatic layout when doing major changes.
